alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mainland Monroe and northern Miami-Dade Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 154 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fortymile Bend, or 22 miles northwest of The Redland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shark Valley Obs Tower, Fortymile Bend and Everglades National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
